vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
Βηθανία, -ας (also -ιά, indecl., Luk.19:29 and in B*, Mrk.11:1), ἡ, (Heb. בֵּית עֲנִיָּה, house of affliction, accusative to Jerome, or perh., house of dates, cf. Bethphage),
Bethany;
__1. a village fifteen furlongs from Jerusalem, the modern El Azerîyeh: Mat.21:17 26:6, Mrk.8:22 (WH, mg.) 11:1, 11, 12 14:3 Luk.19:29 24:50, Jhn.11:1, 18 12:1.
__2. A place on E. bank of Jordan: Jhn.1:28 (R, mg., Βηθαβαρά, which see).
† (From Abbott-Smith. LSJ has no entry)
vocabInfos.shortDef: Bethany, "House of Ananiah" [or "the poor" or "unripe figs]"
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
§ Bethany, "House of Ananiah" [or "the poor" or "unripe figs]"
Bethany, (1) A village near Jerusalem, at the Mount of Olives, Mt. 21:17; Mk. 11:1. (2) A village beyond the Jordan, Jn. 1:28
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
伯大尼 这个專有名詞 地名在亞蘭文的意思是 "棗椰之家" 或 "悲慘之家"
1) 橄欖山上的一個村子, 離耶路撒冷約三公里
2) 在約但東岸的一個地方, 約翰在那裡受洗 (約 1:28)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
伯大尼这个专有名词地名在亚兰文的意思是"枣椰之家" 或"悲惨之家"
1) 橄榄山上的一个村子, 离耶路撒冷约三公里
2) 在约但东岸的一个地方, 约翰在那里受洗(约1:28)
